text: +1 It's even worse, there is no CORS support.

Here's the serverless.json. I'm sending a webhook via Bruno to the right end point (<http://44965533.hs-sites.com/hs/serverless/path/to/hotcats|44965533.hs-sites.com/hs/serverless/path/to/hotcats> -- the sandbox's domain), with the right inputs. The Google API is just not able to read in the client secrets file when I do so ... even though when I run the function via a card it works perfectly
looks like you're using the old version of the serverless.json, what does your hsproject.json look like? EDIT: scratch that looks like it's the new platform version
you just want to double check that your hsproject.json file matches
How should the hsproject.json look? Mine right now just has the name and directory?

Thanks both! I've also sent HubSpot support a screen recording where I call the function via the card, and it works (with logs only on a dev server in my terminal), and then the error when I try to run it via the webhook, if helpful: <https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/na4mwcgl3mvp9ncwgex54/HubSpot-App-not-working-clip.zip?rlkey=eyt05zk0t7ovw2zdeoy4s1nx8&dl=0>
